content: NEW YORK  Sept 20 Toys "R" Us Inc will shrink its stores and revamp its bigger outlets through its bankruptcy process  which may end with the company's return to the public markets  Chief Executive David Brandon said on Wednesday.
name: Vornado Realty Trust
title: Toys 'R' Us CEO sees future with smaller shops

content: * Vornado provides information regarding its investment in Toys “R” Us
name: Vornado Realty Trust
title: BRIEF-Vornado provides information regarding its investment in Toys “R” Us

content: Toys "R" Us Inc has been making $400 million in interest payments on its debt every year  largely due to its $6.6 billion leveraged buyout in 2005. This week  it succumbed to its debt burden  leading to the biggest bankruptcy of a U.S. retailer since that of Kmart in 2004.
name: Vornado Realty Trust
title: How $5 billion of debt caught up with Toys 'R' Us

content: Sept 20 Toys "R" Us Inc has been making $400 million in interest payments on its debt every year  largely due to its $6.6 billion leveraged buyout in 2005. This week  it succumbed to its debt burden  leading to the biggest bankruptcy of a U.S. retailer since that of Kmart in 2004.
